SocialDynamicsOfScience

Class Paper

  • java.lang.Object
    • SocialDynamicsOfScience.Paper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISDoS

    public class Paper
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISDoS
    Paper is relation between authors, edge between authors in co-authorship network. There are three elements in the SDS model: papers, authors, and disciplines. It represents a social network among authors. The social network starts with one author writing one paper in one discipline. The network then evolves as new authors join, new papers are written, and new disciplines emerge over time.
    Version:
    V1.0 - Alpha
    Author:
    Kemal Akkoyun $ 11076004
    See Also:
    ISDoS

      • unionOfSharedDisciplines

        private java.util.ArrayList<Discipline> unionOfSharedDisciplines
        We propose a simple mechanism to model knowledge diffusion through collaboration in SDS: when authors write a paper together, they all contribute their knowledge. Therefore, a paper inherits the union of the author disciplines as topics. However, the discipline that is shared by the majority of authors is selected as the main topic of the paper; (say, the publication venue) and diffuses across all the authors. Through the collaboration, authors acquire knowledge of and membership in this area. unionOfSharedDiscipline: A list of diffused knowledge through paper.
        See Also:
        Discipline

      • decideDiscipline

        public void decideDiscipline(repast.simphony.context.Context<ISDoS> context)
        We propose a simple mechanism to model knowledge diffusion through collaboration in SDS: when authors write a paper together, they all contribute their knowledge. Therefore, a paper inherits the union of the author disciplines as topics. However, the discipline that is shared by the majority of authors is selected as the main topic of the paper; (say, the publication venue) and diffuses across all the authors. Through the collaboration, authors acquire knowledge of and membership in this area. unionOfSharedDiscipline: A list of diffused knowledge through paper.
        Parameters:
        context - Context of paper agent that it belong.
